What does CSS stand for?: What are the three ways to add CSS to HTML?
Cascading Style Sheets:
1. Inline styles (style attribute)
2. Internal stylesheet (<style> tag in <head>)
3. External stylesheet (<link> tag to .css file)

What does CSS stand for?: Which method of adding CSS is considered best practice and why?
Cascading Style Sheets: External stylesheet - keeps HTML and CSS separate, allows reusability across multiple pages, and maintains clean code organization

What does CSS stand for?: What is the basic syntax of a CSS rule?
Cascading Style Sheets: selector { property: value

What does CSS stand for?: What are the three basic CSS selectors?
Cascading Style Sheets:
1. Element selector (p, div, h1)
2. Class selector (.classname)
3. ID selector (#idname)

What does CSS stand for?: How do you select multiple elements with one rule in CSS?
Cascading Style Sheets: Use commas to separate selectors: p, div, h1 { color: red; }

What does CSS stand for?: What does "cascade" mean in CSS?
Cascading Style Sheets: The cascade is the algorithm that determines which CSS rules apply when multiple rules target the same element

What does CSS stand for?: What are the three factors that determine which CSS rule wins in the cascade (in order)?
Cascading Style Sheets:
1. Specificity (most important)
2. Source order (when specificity is equal)
3. Inheritance

What does CSS stand for?: How is CSS specificity calculated? What is the (0-0-0) format?
Cascading Style Sheets:
(ID - CLASS - ELEMENT)
First digit: Number of ID selectors
Second digit: Number of class selectors, attributes, pseudo-classes
Third digit: Number of element/type selectors

What does CSS stand for?: Calculate the specificity: .header .nav li
Cascading Style Sheets: (0-2-1) - 2 classes and 1 element

What does CSS stand for?: Calculate the specificity: #main p.highlight
Cascading Style Sheets: (1-1-1) - 1 ID, 1 class, 1 element

What does CSS stand for?: Which selector has higher specificity: div.text or .text.child?
Cascading Style Sheets: .text.child (0-2-0) beats div.text (0-1-1)

What does CSS stand for?: What is a descendant selector in CSS?
Cascading Style Sheets: A selector with a space between parts that targets elements nested inside other elements. Example: .parent .child selects .child inside .parent

What does CSS stand for?: What is a compound selector in CSS?
Cascading Style Sheets: Multiple selectors written together WITHOUT spaces, targeting elements that have ALL specified classes/attributes. Example: .class1.class2

What does CSS stand for?: What's the difference between ".para .small" and ".para.small"?
Cascading Style Sheets:
.para .small selects .small INSIDE .para (descendant)
".para.small" selects elements with BOTH classes (compound)

What does CSS stand for?: What's the difference between ".para, .small" and ".para.small"?
Cascading Style Sheets:
.para, .small selects ALL .para elements AND ALL .small elements (group selector)
".para.small" selects ONLY elements with both classes (compound)

What does CSS stand for?: When two CSS rules have the same specificity, which one wins?
Cascading Style Sheets: The last one in the source order (the one that appears later in the CSS file)

What does CSS stand for?: What is inheritance in CSS?
Cascading Style Sheets: Some CSS properties (like color, font) are passed from parent elements to their children automatically

What does CSS stand for?: What keyboard shortcut opens Developer Tools in most browsers?
Cascading Style Sheets: F12 or Ctrl+Shift+I (Cmd+Option+I on Mac)

What does CSS stand for?: How do you inspect a specific element on a webpage?
Cascading Style Sheets: Right-click on the element and select "Inspect" or "Inspect Element"

What does CSS stand for?: In DevTools, how can you temporarily edit CSS to test changes?
Cascading Style Sheets: Click on any CSS property or value in the Styles panel and edit it directly (changes are temporary)

What does CSS stand for?: What does the "Computed" tab show in DevTools?
Cascading Style Sheets: The final calculated styles that are actually applied to an element after all CSS rules are processed

What does CSS stand for?: How can you see which CSS file and line number a style comes from in DevTools?
Cascading Style Sheets: Look at the right side of each CSS rule in the Styles panel - it shows filename:line-number

What does CSS stand for?: What do crossed-out styles in DevTools indicate?
Cascading Style Sheets: Styles that are being overridden by other rules with higher specificity or later source order

What does CSS stand for?: What are the four parts of the CSS Box Model (from inside to outside)?
Cascading Style Sheets:
1. Content
2. Padding
3. Border
4. Margin

What does CSS stand for?: What does padding do in the box model?
Cascading Style Sheets: Adds space INSIDE the element, between the content and the border. Background color extends into padding.

What does CSS stand for?: What does margin do in the box model?
Cascading Style Sheets: Adds space OUTSIDE the element, creating distance between elements. Margin is always transparent.

What does CSS stand for?: What's the difference between padding and margin?
Cascading Style Sheets: Padding is inside the border (background color shows), margin is outside the border (always transparent)

What does CSS stand for?: How do you set different values for each side with padding/margin?
Cascading Style Sheets: padding: top right bottom left
column3:
(clockwise from top)
OR use individual properties: padding-top, padding-right, etc.

What does CSS stand for?: What is the shorthand for padding: 10px 10px 10px 10px?
Cascading Style Sheets: padding: 10px

What does CSS stand for?: What is the shorthand for margin: 10px 20px 10px 20px?
Cascading Style Sheets: margin: 10px 20px

What does CSS stand for?: What does box-sizing: border-box do?
Cascading Style Sheets: Makes width and height include padding and border (instead of just content)

What does CSS stand for?: By default, if an element has width: 100px, padding: 10px, and border: 5px, what's its total width?
Cascading Style Sheets: 130px (100 + 10*2 + 5*2) - content + padding + border

What does CSS stand for?: What is margin collapse?
Cascading Style Sheets: When vertical margins of adjacent elements touch, they collapse into a single margin (the larger one wins)

What does CSS stand for?: Do horizontal margins collapse?
Cascading Style Sheets: No, only vertical (top and bottom) margins collapse

What does CSS stand for?: What are the characteristics of block-level elements?
Cascading Style Sheets:
1. Take up full width available
2. Start on a new line
3. Can have width, height, margin, and padding on all sides

What does CSS stand for?: Name 5 common block-level elements
Cascading Style Sheets: div, p, h1-h6, ul, li, section, article, header, footer, main

What does CSS stand for?: What are the characteristics of inline elements?
Cascading Style Sheets:
1. Only take up as much width as needed
2. Don't start on a new line
3. Can't set width or height
4. Vertical margin and padding don't affect layout

What does CSS stand for?: Name 5 common inline elements
Cascading Style Sheets: span, a, strong, em, img, button, input, label, code

What does CSS stand for?: Can you put a block element inside an inline element?
Cascading Style Sheets: No, it's invalid HTML (though browsers may still render it)

What does CSS stand for?: What does display: inline-block do?
Cascading Style Sheets: Makes an element behave like inline (sits on same line) but allows width, height, and vertical margin/padding like block

What does CSS stand for?: What's the difference between display: none and visibility: hidden?
Cascading Style Sheets:
display: none removes element from layout completely
visibility: hidden hides element but preserves its space

What does CSS stand for?: Can you set width and height on inline elements?
Cascading Style Sheets: No, width and height are ignored on inline elements (except replaced elements like img)

What does CSS stand for?: What happens when you add vertical margin to an inline element?
Cascading Style Sheets: It has no effect - vertical margins don't work on inline elements

What does CSS stand for?: If .button has background: white and #confirm-button has background: green, what color is an element with id="confirm-button" class="button"?
Cascading Style Sheets: Green - ID selector (1-0-0) beats class selector (0-1-0)

Cascading Style Sheets: p&gt

What does CSS stand for?: What's wrong with this selector: .parent.child (if trying to select .child inside .parent)?
Cascading Style Sheets: Missing space - should be .parent .child for descendant selector

What does CSS stand for?: How would you select all direct children of a div with class "container"?
Cascading Style Sheets: .container > *

What does CSS stand for?: If two rules have specificity (0-1-0) and (0-0-2), which wins?
Cascading Style Sheets: (0-1-0) wins - one class beats two elements

What does CSS stand for?: What unit is best for font-size: px, em, or rem? Why?
Cascading Style Sheets: rem is often best - relative to root font size, predictable, and allows user scaling
